links.title: Value categories - cppreference.com
links.description: Each C++ expression (an operator with its operands, a literal, a variable name, etc.) is characterized by two independent properties: a type and a value category. Desc:- This will split Alter into 2 different commits. START ALTER and COMMIT
/ROLLBACK ALTER , Start Alter will be written in binlog as soon as we get the
locks for the table, alter will proceeds as usual and at the time of writing
binlog if alter is successful we will write COMMIT Alter other wise ROLLBACK
Alter.

links.title: Moving the kernel to modern C
links.description:
Despite its generally fast-moving nature, the kernel project relies on a
number of old tools.  While critics like to focus on the community's
extensive use of email, a possibly more significant anachronism is the use
of the 1989 version of the C language standard for kernel code ‚Äî a standard
that was codified before the kernel project even began over 30 years ago.
It is looking like that longstanding practice could be coming to an end as
soon as ...

links.title: How My COBOL Code Ended Up in the Original "Terminator" Movie
links.description: I received an email this past Monday from John Graham-Cumming with a surprising question: "Did you know your code was in the original Terminator movie?" I had no clue. My first thought was 6502 code: I had written a lot of it, and I knew that the Terminator apparently used the 6502 instruction set.
